185918898.review: LEGO Batman completes the original trilogy of  LEGO Games, and is very well-regarded due to this. The title is well-deserved, as this game has all of the charm of the other games while also giving off its own haunting atmosphere. The game is a lot of fun and it is a must play for any Lego fans, Batman fans, or gaming fans in general. I highly enjoy the level design, the characters, the free play aspects, and the stories here. My only gripe with the entire game is how odd some things are. For example, the Extra Toggle feature just doesn't work most of the time, if at all, there are no Gold Bricks which is a choice, and there are characters such as Ra's al Ghul who are unlocked in very odd ways. I was scratching my head wondering how I was supposed to get this final character and then he just appeared in the shop. Odd stuff. Overall, though, this game is a masterpiece and gets my seal of approval, for whatever that's worth. 10/10

185832678.review:
I have been having a blast revisiting this old timey gem! It works pretty well overall, but there are a few important things to consider before you buy.

First of all, there are occasional crashes. Emphasis on occasional; I don't get too many. But they do happen.

Second, it is IMPERATIVE that you turn on VSync in the options. Otherwise, Tech Suit Robin's car CANNOT go up slopes and you will be softlocked. So go into options, highlight the Vsync option, and move the arrow keys/control stick to the left/right. (Yes, it's a weird control option.)

Once you do that, though, you should be home free! I do recommend playing this with controller, but it is playable on keyboard.

185446353.review: Lego Batman is an action-packed game for kids, bursting with puzzles, humour, and colourful characters. Adults might find it oddly compelling for its unapologetic approach to smashing the mentally ill into a pile of Lego bits. 184626205.review:
This game takes me back to my childhood, as a <7/8 Year old boy, that loved batman and was introduced via Lego Indiana Jones, and Lego Batman: The Videogame.

A solid foundation of for Lego games going forwards, easy to play as most Lego Games, but it doesn't feel like a simple re-skin of other Lego games, it feels more original.

Level art style is unique and similar to that of the classic Lego Batman movies, portraying Gotham City as dark, as well as many comical references. each character mostly resembling their comic suits.

Well designed and well developed game mechanics, lotsa bugs that are funny to discover with your friends Via remoteplay, We love to break the game, by escaping areas/boundaries and finding other ways too play/beat the levels of the game, compared to how they are meant to be played.

184343268.review:
LEGO® Batman™: The Videogame is an action-adventure game that blends the world of Gotham City with the signature LEGO humor and charm. As part of the popular LEGO video game series, it lets players take control of Batman, Robin, and a variety of iconic Batman villains as they embark on various adventures. The game is known for its family-friendly approach, offering a fun and lighthearted experience without sacrificing depth or excitement.

The game’s story is divided into two parts: one where you play as the heroes, and another where you control the villains. This dual perspective adds variety to the gameplay, as you switch between fighting crime and causing mayhem. The levels are filled with puzzles, combat, and exploration, and the game’s signature LEGO mechanics—such as building objects from bricks to solve puzzles—are front and center, offering a mix of action and brain-teasing gameplay.

The strength of LEGO® Batman™ lies in its engaging gameplay and cooperative mechanics. It’s a great game for players of all ages, especially with its two-player co-op mode, allowing friends or family to team up and take on the game together. The humorous take on the Batman universe adds charm, with characters and environments crafted in a fun, LEGO-style that appeals to both children and adults alike.

On the downside, while the game’s puzzles are fun, they can occasionally feel repetitive, especially after prolonged sessions. Additionally, the combat mechanics are simple and lack depth, which might leave more experienced gamers craving a bit more challenge. The story, while entertaining, is fairly straightforward and doesn’t offer much beyond the basic LEGO formula.

Despite these minor issues, LEGO® Batman™: The Videogame remains a delightful and accessible title, especially for younger audiences or families looking for a cooperative gaming experience. Its combination of humor, puzzles, and action makes it a strong entry in the LEGO game series.

Score: 8/10 – A fun and family-friendly action-adventure with charming LEGO humor, though it can feel repetitive at times.

183992065.review:
Para quem jogou essa obra de arte no Playstation 2, só de olhar a capa já arrepia e da vontade de jogar. 
É um jogo nostálgico e que envelheceu como vinho, além de ser um jogo extremamente divertido o fator memória que atinge o jogador é absurdo. Essa trilha sonora que veio a partir do Batman do Michael Keaton mexe com qualquer um. 
É sem dúvidas o melhor LEGO já feito, além de ser um clássico ele tem uma história divertida e você ainda pode jogar pelo lado dos vilões também! Tem uma batcaverna rica e cheia de detalhes, as fases te prendem 100%, RESUMINDO, é muito divertido.
Se você nunca jogou, não vai se arrepender, ele vale cada centavo, compre e aproveite as aventuras de Batman e Robin, em uma era clássica dos LEGOs em que eles não falavam nada e era apenas linguagem não verbal.
(Destaco que vale muito mais a pena jogar com o controle)
